      • Board

        public Board(int screenSize,
             int boardLength,
             MatchThreeGame app)
        Constructor for Board specifying the dimensions of the Screen it will reside in
        Parameters:
        screenSize - the size (in pixels) of the Screen the Board will be added to
        boardLength - the length of both sides of the array holding the GamePieces
        app - the application in which the board resides

        col - The end row
        deltaR - The change in row
        deltaC - The change in column

        public boolean hasEmptySpaces()
        returns whether there are any empty spaces on the board
        Returns:

      • getPiece

        public GamePiece getPiece(int screenRow,
                          int screenCol)
        Helper method to translate where the piece appears visually to its actual position in the array. This method is needed because what appears on the board is different than what is actually in the array. For example, what would appear to be board[row][col] on the board would actually be represented by board[col][row] in the array.
        Parameters:
        screenRow - the row at which the piece appears to be on the visual representation of the board
        screenCol - the column at which the piece appears to be on the visual representation of the board
        Returns:
        a reference to the piece that appears to be at board[screenRow][screenCol]

      • setPiece

        public void setPiece(GamePiece piece,
                     int screenRow,
                     int screenCol)
        Sets the piece at board[screenCol][screenRow] to the specified piece, and updates the references inside the piece accordingly. This row and column references are reversed because what appears on the board is different than what is actually in the array. For example, what would appear to be board[row][col] on the board would actually be represented by board[col][row] in the array.
        Parameters:
        piece - the piece to be inserted into the board at board[screenCol][screenRow]
        screenRow - the row at which the piece will appear to be on the visual representation of the board
        screenCol - the column at which the piece will appear to be on the visual representation of the board

      • onClick

        public void onClick(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Method that handles all clicks on the board and handles swapping, refilling, and scoring
        Specified by:
        onClick in interface thewetbandits.utils.Clickable

      • swapPiece

        private void swapPiece(int r1,
                       int c1,
                       int r2,
                       int c2)
        swaps the piece at board[r1][c1] with the piece at board[r2][c2]
        Parameters:
        r1 - the row of the first piece
        c1 - the column of the first piece
        r2 - the row of the second piece
        c2 - the column of the second piece
